body:
Please try your command without placing paths around quotes. Dry run option
is to see what changes will take affect without causing any changes.

rclone sync --dry-run /home/me/tmp onedrive:tmp

rclone copy --dry-run /home/me/tmp onedrive:tmp

Please try this filter option flag with your command..

rclone copy  --include _+_.\* --dry-run /home/me/tmp onedrive:tmp

Regards,
Zeshan

On Wed, Aug 17, 2016, 1:56 AM devinkwok notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> Thanks for all the hard work on rclone! I've been using it to make offsite
> backups of my data to Microsoft OneDrive, and I noticed filenames with plus
> signs (+) were returning File not in Local file system at
> /home/devin/d/data in my logs. It appears rclone is replacing "+" with
> spaces (tes+t.txt becomes tes t.txt), and failing to copy filenames that
> start with "+" (+test.txt fails to copy). I'm pretty sure "+" is a valid
> character in both Windows and Linux, and I had no trouble copying the same
> files to OneDrive manually. I also tried syncing with rclone to Google
> Drive, and did not have this issue.
> 
> Using a dummy folder ~/tmp, I collected the following info:
> - Version: rclone v1.32
> - OS: Windows 10 x64 and Ubuntu 16.04 x64
> - Destination: Microsoft OneDrive (Google Drive works as expected)
> - Commands: rclone sync "/home/me/tmp" "onedrive:tmp" -v and rclone
>   copy "/home/me/tmp" "onedrive:tmp" -v both fail.
> - Comparing the directories:
> 
> Source is rclone ls "/home/me/tmp" -q:
> 
> ```
>     6 test3.t+xt
>     5 test+a.txt
>     6 +test.txt
>     5 a/test+a.txt
> ```
> 
> Destination rclone ls "onedrive:tmp" -q is missing a file, other
> filenames changed:
> 
> ```
>     5 test a.txt
>     6 test3.t xt
>     5 a/test a.txt
> ```
> - Sample log:
>   
>   2016/08/16 23:45:10 rclone: Version "v1.32" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "/home/me/tmp" "onedrive:tmp" "--config" ".rclone.conf" "-v" "--retries" "1"]
>   2016/08/16 23:45:11 One drive root 'tmp': Modify window is 1s
>   2016/08/16 23:45:11 One drive root 'tmp': Reading ""
>   2016/08/16 23:45:11 One drive root 'tmp': Finished reading ""
>   2016/08/16 23:45:11 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
>   2016/08/16 23:45:11 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
>   2016/08/16 23:45:12 +test.txt: Failed to copy: invalidRequest: nameContainsInvalidCharacters: Path (/LiveFolders/tmp/ test.txt) contains invalid leading character.
>   2016/08/16 23:45:12 +test.txt: Removing failed copy
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 test+a.txt: Copied (new)
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 test3.t+xt: Copied (new)
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 +test.txt: Failed to remove failed copy: invalidRequest: generalException: API not found
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 a/test+a.txt: Copied (new)
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 One drive root 'tmp': not deleting files as there were IO errors
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 Attempt 1/1 failed with 1 errors and: not deleting files as there were IO errors
>   2016/08/16 23:45:13 Failed to sync: not deleting files as there were IO errors
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/620, or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGXRY9UKzxP48unZ8bh_-aMQhDAP6XwIks5qgqKTgaJpZM4JmHkD
> .

Tried `rclone sync /home/me/tmp onedrive:tmp` and `rclone copy /home/me/tmp onedrive:tmp` without quotes, no difference. Dry run outputs without errors: 
2016/08/17 14:15:36 rclone: Version "v1.32" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "/home/me/tmp" "onedrive:tmp" "-v" "--config" ".rclone.conf" "--retries" "1" "--dry-run"]
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Modify window is 1s
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Not making directory as dry run is set
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Reading ""
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Finished reading ""
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
2016/08/17 14:15:37 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
2016/08/17 14:15:37 test+a.txt: Not copying as --dry-run
2016/08/17 14:15:37 test3.t+xt: Not copying as --dry-run
2016/08/17 14:15:37 +test.txt: Not copying as --dry-run
2016/08/17 14:15:37 a/test+a.txt: Not copying as --dry-run
2016/08/17 14:15:37 
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            4
Elapsed time:        1.4s
2016/08/17 14:15:37 Go routines at exit 2
The filter options --include _+_.\* excludes test3.t+xt from copying, and still fails to copy +test.txt: 
2016/08/17 14:17:15 rclone: Version "v1.32" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "/home/me/tmp" "onedrive:tmp" "-v" "--config" ".rclone.conf" "--retries" "1" "--include" "*+*.*"]
2016/08/17 14:17:16 One drive root 'tmp': Modify window is 1s
2016/08/17 14:17:16 One drive root 'tmp': Reading ""
2016/08/17 14:17:16 test3.t+xt: Excluded from sync (and deletion)
2016/08/17 14:17:16 One drive root 'tmp': Finished reading ""
2016/08/17 14:17:16 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for checks to finish
2016/08/17 14:17:16 One drive root 'tmp': Waiting for transfers to finish
2016/08/17 14:17:17 +test.txt: Failed to copy: invalidRequest: nameContainsInvalidCharacters: Path (/LiveFolders/tmp/ test.txt) contains invalid leading character.
2016/08/17 14:17:17 +test.txt: Removing failed copy
2016/08/17 14:17:17 +test.txt: Failed to remove failed copy: invalidRequest: generalException: API not found
2016/08/17 14:17:17 test+a.txt: Copied (new)
2016/08/17 14:17:18 a/test+a.txt: Copied (new)
2016/08/17 14:17:18 Attempt 1/1 failed with 1 errors and: invalidRequest: nameContainsInvalidCharacters: Path (/LiveFolders/tmp/ test.txt) contains invalid leading character.
2016/08/17 14:17:18 Failed to copy: invalidRequest: nameContainsInvalidCharacters: Path (/LiveFolders/tmp/ test.txt) contains invalid leading character.
It looks like + is being silently replaced by spaces, and since spaces are invalid at the start of filenames on OneDrive, they cause the error `Failed to copy: invalidRequest: nameContainsInvalidCharacters: Path (/LiveFolders/tmp/ test.txt) contains invalid leading character`. Maybe it's a character encoding issue? I tested the URI path characters from [https://dev.onedrive.com/misc/path-encoding.htm](https://dev.onedrive.com/misc/path-encoding.htm), and when OneDrive replaces invalid characters like ~ with ～, rclone doesn't seem to print those codepoints correctly (`～` shows as `я╜Ю` in terminal). I haven't figured out exactly what's going on, but I've forked the project and I'll do some digging when I have time.

This is probably related to #218 .

The `+` being translated to ` ` means that it is to do with URL encoding going wrong.

> when OneDrive replaces invalid characters like ~ with ～

It is rclone doing those replacements. I suspect the reason why they don't display is that your terminal is not displaying UTF-8 characters.  rclone expects everything to be using UTF-8.

To confirm, Is it possible to run terminal with UTF-8.

I came across this distribution independent article online.

https://perlgeek.de/en/article/set-up-a-clean-utf8-environment

Regards,
Zeshan

On Thu, Aug 18, 2016, 5:24 AM Nick Craig-Wood notifications@github.com
wrote:

> This is probably related to #218
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/218 .
> 
> The + being translated to means that it is to do with URL encoding going
> wrong.
> 
> when OneDrive replaces invalid characters like ~ with ～
> 
> It is rclone doing those replacements. I suspect the reason why they don't
> display is that your terminal is not displaying UTF-8 characters. rclone
> expects everything to be using UTF-8.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> 
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/620#issuecomment-240670403, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGXRYws5GowXMLeJB7rUqC1n4H4NXo5Bks5qhCTVgaJpZM4JmHkD
> .

I've fixed this in the beta

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.32-34-g037a000%CE%B2/

Which will be part of the v1.33 release

Please re-open if you find any problems with it!

Hi
I'm using OneDrive connector in a Logic App and found the same issue, as of Oct. 2020. The + sign in a filename is replaced by a single space when trying to get the content. However, the filenames are well picked up when listing the folder content. See pictures attached. 

logic app overview:
--------------------
![error1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39949042/95583170-a737e480-0a33-11eb-8760-80205e8c9a20.png)

list files actions output (correct):
------------------------------------
![listfiles](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39949042/95583164-a56e2100-0a33-11eb-8717-592ca0c62b10.png)

get content action (incorrect path):
-------------------------------------
![error-getcontent](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39949042/95583155-a2733080-0a33-11eb-9874-6fa237a22450.png)

Thank you
Fernando
@screen-saksrepo is this using rclone anywhere? If so I can't see where :-)

```
rclone v1.53.4
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.7
```
Also running into this just now.

Filename `01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3` ends up like so on OneDrive
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1641362/106622817-48fbb800-6574-11eb-98d3-a5bd0a468b48.png)


```
[0] % rclone -v --bwlimit 2M copy ~/Nextcloud/HugeFiles/Music onedrive:Music
2021/02/02 16:29:29 INFO  : Starting bandwidth limiter at 2MBytes/s
2021/02/02 16:29:45 INFO  : Radiohead - Hail To the Thief/01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3: Copied (new)
2021/02/02 16:29:45 INFO  : 
Transferred:        7.913M / 7.913 MBytes, 100%, 1.582 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:              2241 / 2241, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        15.6s


[0] % rclone -v --bwlimit 2M copy ~/Nextcloud/HugeFiles/Music onedrive:Music
2021/02/02 16:29:53 INFO  : Starting bandwidth limiter at 2MBytes/s
2021/02/02 16:30:08 INFO  : Radiohead - Hail To the Thief/01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3: Copied (new)
2021/02/02 16:30:08 INFO  : 
Transferred:        7.913M / 7.913 MBytes, 100%, 1.767 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:              2241 / 2241, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        14.7s
```

rclone keeps trying to sync it on almost each run.

Weirdly enough, after running rclone multiple times(and deleting the file manually through OneDrive's web UI) I end up in this state.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1641362/106624775-4d28d500-6576-11eb-909e-10a427794f6c.png)

Also have the same issue with `07 - Bangers + Mash.mp3`.

If I run the `copy` enough times and run a `sync` afterwards I end up with the correct file structure.
@C0rn3j - can you open a new issue with this in please? Something weird is going on definitely!

issue.title: Plus signs (+) in filename end up being spaces or fail syncing sometimes on OneDrive

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This is similar to #620

```
rclone v1.53.4
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.7
```

Filename `01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3` ends up like so on OneDrive
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1641362/106622817-48fbb800-6574-11eb-98d3-a5bd0a468b48.png)


```
[0] % rclone -v --bwlimit 2M copy ~/Nextcloud/HugeFiles/Music onedrive:Music
2021/02/02 16:29:29 INFO  : Starting bandwidth limiter at 2MBytes/s
2021/02/02 16:29:45 INFO  : Radiohead - Hail To the Thief/01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3: Copied (new)
2021/02/02 16:29:45 INFO  : 
Transferred:        7.913M / 7.913 MBytes, 100%, 1.582 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:              2241 / 2241, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        15.6s


[0] % rclone -v --bwlimit 2M copy ~/Nextcloud/HugeFiles/Music onedrive:Music
2021/02/02 16:29:53 INFO  : Starting bandwidth limiter at 2MBytes/s
2021/02/02 16:30:08 INFO  : Radiohead - Hail To the Thief/01 - 2 + 2 = 5.mp3: Copied (new)
2021/02/02 16:30:08 INFO  : 
Transferred:        7.913M / 7.913 MBytes, 100%, 1.767 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:              2241 / 2241, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:        14.7s
```

rclone keeps trying to sync it on almost each run.

Weirdly enough, after running rclone multiple times(and deleting the file manually through OneDrive's web UI) I end up in this state.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1641362/106624775-4d28d500-6576-11eb-909e-10a427794f6c.png)

Also have the same issue with `07 - Bangers + Mash.mp3`.

If I run the `copy` enough times and run a `sync` afterwards I end up with the correct file structure.

body: @ncw wasn't sure if I should since my issue was pretty much identical, did so now though
